message_1:
Solve the following system of equations using the substitution method:

5x + 2y = 13
3x - y = 5
message_2:
First, we will solve one of the equations for one variable in terms of the other variable. Let's solve the second equation for y:

3x - y = 5
y = 3x - 5

Now, we will substitute this expression for y into the first equation:

5x + 2(3x - 5) = 13

Now, we will solve for x:

5x + 6x - 10 = 13
11x = 23
x = 23/11

Now that we have the value of x, we will substitute it back into the expression for y:

y = 3(23/11) - 5
y = 69/11 - 55/11
y = 14/11

So, the solution to the system of equations is x = 23/11 and y = 14/11.
